content.prompt:
Thoroughbred race horses are subject to intense artificial selection to produce faster-running horses. The results of breeding programs can be seen in the change in winning times of the Kentucky Derby from 1880 to the present, as shown in Figure 1.

Figure 1. Best-fit curve for winning times in the Kentucky Derby since 1880

Which of the following best explains the trend shown in Figure 1?

choices.label: The distance the horses ran became shorter between 1880 and 1940.
All of the selective breeding programs ended in 1940.
After 1940, natural selection prevented any additional speed increases.
By 1940, most genetic variation for speed had been lost from the gene pool.
